review_text: Excellent SEO course, simple to understand and yet very complete with info!
It was good, waiting for more advanced courses. Thanks
good course
So much information.  My head is spinning right now.  I really appreciate this SEO Fundamentals course.
Excellent so far

Overall great course.  Takes all the mystery the SEO is shrouded in away.  A couple things to note: it's Google search "console" not "council!"  Also, some of the quizzes have typos and some of the questions have incorrect answers attached to them.  The chapter 6 quiz has a question about wireframing which isn't mentioned until chapter 7.  Chapter 4 quiz has a question about placement of title tags which has the incorrect answer attached to the question.
Been doing SEO for 10 years with great results but this training is excellent giving me the information I can use.  For a beginner great place to be to learn SEO at a great slow pace
Great course. I have been an SEO professional for several years, and this is both a great refresher and it did offer many insights on how to be more effective in my work. Thank you for creating it.
Well designed but presenter described paid tools maximum times. Every beginner can't afford all these paid tools.
this is not a SEO 101 class you hve to know a lot as he moves fast and assumes alot
Very relevant and informative
Outstanding overview of SEO.
Very thorough and not boring.

Its definitely a great course, however to actually gain the full amount of experience you would need to buy about 300$ worth of online services/software, which will be needed to work with SEO. But to have the full experience, the SEO expert should show more ways to work with SEO without paying a fortune, as we know we are all here freelancers.

Wow...

Such a detailed course... Loved it...

I use many of those tools, but I got a few valuable tips here on how to improve my game. In terms of SEO, a few % improvement is great and I'm sure that this will help me in the future.

Thank you :)

Painfully unengaging, and the tests are very obviously skewed toward SEMrush vs actual practices. I felt like I was bombarded with data instead of taught.

Final should not have focused on the example site's load rate, page result totals as seen in the videos and etc. That's irrelevant to if you understand SEO. That's trivial memorization to check if the person watched the videos- NOT SEO recollection.

Me as marketer and musician getting into the SEO world, I find this a very strong course. When the title course says “The Ultimate Framework”, it really is! The content guides very well a person who wants to start or improve their SEO knowledge. And isn’t only focused on Technical SEO but on how to measure, communicate and reporting your efforts to your team and stakeholders. Excellent course!

To be fair, I definitely learned some things about SEO from this course, since I really didn't have any background in the topic before taking it. However, I finished the class with a DISAPPOINTED feeling. This is NOT THE COURSE FOR STUDENTS LOOKING TO GET INTO THE TECHNICAL WEEDS of how SEO works, or how you can improve your site's SEO AT LITTLE OR NO COST. Unfortunately, he stays high level, and when he does jump into specific tools and how to use them, they're tools that cost money (~$100/month!). As a course for people looking to learn fundamentals about SEO, trainers should go in depth with the FREE tools, and then maybe have 1 chapter at the end that explains why some students may want to consider the expensive tools instead. 

Additionally, there's a whole chapter on how to find help through Fiverr and essentially how to email people... that doesn't feel like a chapters worth of material for an SEO Fundamentals course. Also, at least 1 of the quiz questions had an incorrect answer selected as the "right answer", and another chapters question was regarding info that isn't discussed until the following chapter. 

I honestly believe I could have gained more value reading free blog articles, and watching free youtube videos, for the amount of time I spent on this class.

Very helpful course a lot of useful information but some details were messing that you need to search for them in other sources.
Also there are no links to enlarge your knowledge.
Thanks for your effort and we look forward to get more of your good work :) .

Though there is a lot of information in this course, I sometimes found minor details like how long a page took to load then part of the quiz, and though I filled an entire notebook with course notes, I still found some of the questions completely left field. I also found the phrasing and grammar of the questions difficult to understand at times. 

I am a copywriter who was looking for more SEO and Keyword information and knowledge. The advert for this course made me feel I'd get that, but really it's for people who are wanting to build websites from the ground up, which is not something I will ever be doing. So really this course was about 90% pointless for me, but it wasn't advertised that way, unfortunately.
Giving out some written material would be helpful.
Very good
Good course, but sometimes too fast. It's a bit difficult for someone who knows nothing at all about SEO. But with focus you can do it.

Most of the app / software used are premium, so for someone who doesn't have those tools the tutorial is useless.
Thanks
Very indepth knowledge Thanks for sharing
Informative but not as per expectations. Instructor passes things very quickly good for those who already have some knowledge of SEO not recommended to beginners.
It was a good curse and it did help me understand the SEO process better

Not really what I was expecting. The content isn't up to par with other Learn courses and there are some errors which others have mentioned before. I wish I had been told about the focus on using paid SEO sites before I purchased. Not as much value for money here as with so many of the other courses available. Wouldn't recommend this course.

As someone who started out with absolutely no idea how to optimize SEO, I feel I have a very general knowledge of the subject and will be able to apply the teachings to my own projects.  I may one day be able to manage someone else's as well.
Well made course I look forward to applying the new knowledge
Learnt a lot! Very step-by step based. Can't fail if you follow these insights, especially for beginners

I'm not sure this is a course for beginners. There were points in the course where I was totally and absolutely lost just running down the time of the videos however I did learn a couple new things as a beginner.

The tools and methods were not specified properly, secondly the Instructor should focus on the improvement of problem that how to counter any problems
Secondly Notes should be provide for best  outcomes
Some points wee not explained well.
Great course. I'm completely new to SEO and this was a fantastic beginning framework for a newbie like me. Highly recommend!

This course is definitely geared at SEO professionals/project managers — rather than bloggers or website copywriters interested in learning more about SEO best practices (the latter is more of what I was looking for). Therefore, there is a lot more focus on running audits and project management for big clients rather than writing for SEO. There is also extensive use of paid tools that most beginners would not need/afford. That said, there is still a ton of great info and tips and tricks in this course for anyone interested in SEO, and as a writer, it was helpful for me to learn more about the 'backend' of things even if I, myself, won't be using all the tools. The host does get deep into some technical terms very quickly without first defining them, and can go very fast in some of the lessons. Therefore, I'd say this is quite a challenging "fundamentals" course and isn't quite for total novices.
Great course, east to understand. Definitely worth it.
very very informative and learning course i suggest to everyone learn it

Good teacher & info but the Fiverr questions are a little bit off wording wise from what he said. Additionally, in the initial spreadsheet, I did not get his 11 collum template which was a bummer. Could save me a lot of time.
The materials are a bit dated. The big disadvantage here is that you have to pay hefty monthly subscription fees to SEO services to use this information.

The presenter moved through examples quickly and glazed over many words / themes which required more detail. This program dives deep into detail without managing the viewers understanding of key elements before the deep dive. I felt lost at points and overwhelmed with examples and information. Using a health / medical example is very specific and makes it difficult for the viewer to related to some of the searches / keywords, etc. Using an example like clothing, shoes, etc. would be more relatable than strep-throat / medications. Lastly, there should be a clear indexing of common topics / words / and tools. There are too many tools thrown at you from the beginning with most of the tools requiring payment before use. This limits a viewers ability to follow along live with their own examples. Overall, I was excited for this course but feel more confused after the fact. My recommendation is to divide this course into beginner, intermediate, and advanced trainings. Mix up the trainers and find a better space to record (there is clear background noise and the audio is poor at times). I'm going to take more courses on learn. from Fiverr but may move back to Udemy or go right to SEMrush Academy. Thanks for taking the first step.

Using Google Chrome as a browser affected the structure of the course. There were a lot of times the content would stop broadcasting and refreshing wouldn't help. Very helpful information. However, would have loved to have seen more free tools!
Awesome experience. Learned new things that will be helpful in SEO field

I enjoyed the course, but it wasn't totally SEO fundamentals. The presenter used a lot of terminology that I wasn't previously familiar with, so I had to go and Google many terms he used throughout the course. I would have appreciated an initial explanation of each term he used - but I still learned a lot. Thank you.

In the beginning, the instructor was hard to follow. I feel like during the technical side of the course, he could have slowed down a bit and offered more thorough explanations. I had to watch the early videos twice over to catch on, but everything ended up making sense as I went along.
Very informative SEO course. Great for beginners and experienced SEO Specialists.
Amazing! Every SEO Specialist or in the field should watch!
Great!!!

Great course for basics, but honestly, a lot of the material was fairly rushed and not covered as well as I would hope for. The tools that the presenter recommended are great, I will personally use them. However, for someone who does not want to use these tools or cannot afford them it would be hard to extract 100% of the value out of this course. Great presenter, great course though!
nice
